#imports script, filename
from sys import argv
script, filename = argv

#sets txt to open filename
txt = open(filename)

#sets line to txt.read()
line = txt.read()

#sets ln to length of line
ln = len(line)

#sets first to first half of line
first = line[:ln/2]

#sets second to second half of line
second = line[ln/2+1:]

#sets middle to middle of line
middle = line[ln/2]

#sets line to reversed line
line = line[::-1]

#if first and second are the same and line is the same as reversed line
if first == second and line == line:
    print "Yes"
else:
    print "No"
#
input_str = input()
is_palindrome = True

for i in range(int(len(input_str) / 2)):
    if input_str[i] != input_str[-i - 1]:
        is_palindrome = False

if is_palindrome:
    print('Yes')
else:
    print('No')
# coding=utf-8
input_str = input()

if len(input_str) == 1:
    is_palindrome = True
elif len(input_str) == 2:
    if input_str[0] == input_str[1]:
        is_palindrome = True
    else:
        is_palindrome = False
else:
    is_palindrome = True
    for i in range(int(len(input_str) / 2)):
        if input_str[i] != input_str[-i - 1]:
            is_palindrome = False

if is_palindrome:
    print('Yes')
else:
    print('No')


#imports script, filename
from sys import argv
script, filename = argv

#sets text to open filename
text = open(filename)

#sets line to read text
line = text.read()

#sets ln to length of line
ln = len(line)

#sets first to first half of line
first = line[:ln//2]

#sets second to second half of line
second = line[ln//2+1:]

#sets second to reversed second
second = second[::-1]

#sets first to reversed first
first = first[::-1]

#sets middle to middle of line
middle = line[ln//2]

#if first and second are the same and line is the same as reversed line
if first == second and line == line[::-1]:
    print "Yes"
else:
    print "No"


#imports script, filename
from sys import argv
script, filename = argv

#sets txt to open filename
txt = open(filename)

#sets line to txt.read()
line = txt.read()

#sets ln to length of line
ln = len(line)

#sets first to first half of line
first = line[:ln/2]

#sets second to second half of line
second = line[ln/2+1:]

#sets middle to middle of line
middle = line[ln/2]

#if first and second are the same and line is the same as reversed line
if first == second[::-1] and line == line[::-1]:
    print "Yes"
else:
    print "No"

#imports script, filename
from sys import argv
script, filename = argv

#sets txt to open filename
txt = open(filename)

#sets line to read txt
line = txt.read()

#sets ln to length of line
ln = len(line)

#sets first to first half of line (not including middle)
first = line[:ln/2-1]

#sets second to second half of line (not including middle)
second = line[ln/2:]

#sets second to reversed second
second = second[::-1]

#sets first to reversed first
first = first[::-1]

#sets middle to middle of line (including middle)
middle = line[ln/2]

#if first and second are the same and line is the same as reversed line
if first == second and line == line[::-1]:
    print("Yes")
else:
    print("No")
input_str = input()

is_palindrome = True
for i in range(int(len(input_str) / 2)):
    if input_str[i] != input_str[-i - 1]:
        is_palindrome = False

if is_palindrome:
    print("Yes")
else:
    print("No")


# imports script, filename
from sys import argv
script, filename = argv

# sets txt to open filename
txt = open(filename)

# sets line to read txt
line = txt.read()

# sets ln to length of line
ln = len(line)

# sets first to first half of line (not including middle)
first = line[:ln // 2 - 1]

# sets second to second half of line (not including middle)
second = line[ln // 2:]

# sets second to reversed second
second = second[::-1]

# sets first to reversed first
first = first[::-1]

# sets middle to middle of line (including middle)
middle = line[ln // 2]

# if first and second are the same and line is the same as reversed line
if first == second and line == line[::-1]:
    print "Yes"
else:
    print "No"


input_str = input()

is_palindrome = True
for i in range(int(len(input_str) / 2)):
    if input_str[i] != input_str[-i - 1]:
        is_palindrome = False

if is_palindrome:
    print('Yes')
else:
    print('No')

#imports script, filename
from sys import argv
script, filename = argv

#sets txt to open filename
txt = open(filename)

#sets line to read txt
line = txt.read()

#sets ln to length of line
ln = len(line)

#sets first to first half of line (not including middle)
first = line[:ln/2-1]

#sets second to second half of line (not including middle)
second = line[ln/2:]

#sets second to reversed second
second = second[::-1]

#sets first to reversed first
first = first[::-1]

#sets middle to middle of line (including middle)
middle = line[ln/2]

#if first and second are the same and line is the same as reversed line
if first == second and line == line[::-1]:
    print ("Yes")
else:
    print ("No")

# sets line to read text
line = text.read()

# sets ln to length of line
ln = len(line)

# sets first to first half of line
first = line[:ln/2]

# sets second to second half of line
second = line[ln/2+1:]

# sets second to reversed second
second = second[::-1]

# sets first to reversed first
first = first[::-1]

# sets middle to middle of line
middle = line[ln/2]

# if first and second are the same and line is the same as reversed line
if first == second and line == line[::-1]:
    print "Yes"
else:
    print "No"
input_str = input()

    print('Yes')

    print('No')
